content: This article **needs additional citations for verification**. Please help improve this article by adding citations to reliable sources. Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. *Find sources:* "Leng Kee Single Member Constituency" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(January 2022)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)* **Leng Kee Single Member Constituency** was a constituency in Singapore. In 1972, **Leng Kee Constituency** was formed by carving out from [Bukit Merah Constituency](/wiki/Bukit_Merah_Constituency). In 1988, it was renamed as **Leng Kee Single Member Constituency** (SMC) as part of Singapore's political reforms. The SMC was merged into [Tanjong Pagar Group Representation Constituency](/wiki/Tanjong_Pagar_Group_Representation_Constituency) in 1997. ## Member of Parliament **Election** **Member of Parliament****Party****1972**[Ahmad Mattar](/wiki/Ahmad_Mattar)[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)**1976**[Ow Chin Hock](/wiki/Ow_Chin_Hock)**1980****1984****1988****1991** ## Electoral results Note: The [Elections Department](/wiki/Elections_Department_Singapore) does not include rejected votes when calculating the vote shares of candidates. Hence, all candidates' vote shares will total to 100% at any given election (may not appear so in multi-way contests due to rounding). ### Elections in 1970s [General Election 1972](/wiki/1972_Singaporean_general_election): Leng Kee PartyCandidateVotes%**[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)****[Ahmad Mattar](/wiki/Ahmad_Mattar)** **10,929** **68.28** [WP](/wiki/Workers%27_Party_(Singapore))Ng Ho4,03625.21[UNF](/wiki/United_National_Front_(Singapore))N. Logam1,0426.51Majority6,89343.07[Registered electors](/wiki/Voter_registration)17,158[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party) **win** (new seat) This [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) location article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Leng Kee Single Member Constituency
